title: A sharp spectral splitting theorem
authors: Gioacchino Antonelli, Marco Pozzetta, Kai Xu
abstract:
We prove a sharp spectral generalization of the Cheeger--Gromoll splitting
theorem. We show that if a complete non-compact Riemannian manifold $M$ of
dimension $n\geq 2$ has at least two ends and
  \[
  \lambda_1(-\gamma\Delta+\mathrm{Ric})\geq 0,
  \]
  for some $\gamma<\frac{4}{n-1}$, then $M$ splits isometrically as $\mathbb
R\times N$ for some compact manifold $N$ with nonnegative Ricci curvature. We
show that the constant $\frac{4}{n-1}$ is sharp, and the multiple-end
assumption is necessary for any $\gamma>0$.
